excerpt: Surrounded by the 16th-century Venetian Walls, the medieval Città Alta is dominated by the Rocca di Bergamo fortress. Handsome piazzas house the arcaded Palazzo della Ragione, the Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore with its gilded interior, and the intricate marble facade of the Cappella Colleoni. Narrow alleys are lined with upscale indie boutiques and delis, as well as centuries-old cafes, trattorias, and wine bars.
detail_description: Città Alta, located within the 16th-century Venetian Walls, is a medieval gem dominated by the Rocca di Bergamo fortress. The area boasts charming piazzas hosting historic landmarks like the Palazzo della Ragione and Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore. Visitors can explore narrow alleys lined with upscale boutiques, delis, and centuries-old cafes.
name: Città Alta

excerpt: Established museum with works from the 15th–19th centuries by celebrated artists, plus a gift shop.
detail_description: The Accademia Carrara Museum is a renowned art destination in Bergamo, Italy, showcasing an impressive collection of works from the 15th to 19th centuries. The museum features masterpieces by celebrated artists such as Pisanello, Botticelli, Bellini, Moroni, Raffaello, Tiepolo and Canaletto. Visitors can explore nearly 2,000 authentic paintings, sculptures and decorative works within the stunning neoclassical building.
name: Accademia Carrara Museum
address: Piazza Giacomo Carrara, 82, 24121 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: Piazza Vecchia is a stunning square located in the center of the old town, surrounded by noble houses and the Palazzo della Ragione. The Palazzo della Ragione, dating back to the 12th century, features a striking stone staircase and a loggia with three Gothic arches. Adjacent to this architectural marvel stands the Torre del Comune, adding to the historical charm of this picturesque piazza.
name: Piazza Vecchia

excerpt: Romanesque church with an ornate marble porch & a lavishly gilded interior hung with tapestries.
detail_description: The Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore is a stunning Romanesque church featuring an elaborate marble porch and a lavishly gilded interior adorned with tapestries. Originally under the administration of the Chapter of San Vincenzo, it was later entrusted to the Congregazione della Misericordia Maggiore. This historic site served as a Collegiate Church until the 1970s and housed its own clergy and seminary.
name: Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore

excerpt: Bergamo is an Italian city northeast of Milan, in the Lombardy region. Its older upper district, called Città Alta, is characterized by cobblestone streets, encircled by Venetian walls and accessible by funicular. It's home to the Duomo di Bergamo, the city cathedral. Also here are the Romanesque Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore and the grand Cappella Colleoni, a chapel with 18th-century frescoes by Tiepolo.
detail_description: Bergamo, an Italian city in the Lombardy region, is known for its charming Città Alta, featuring cobblestone streets and Venetian walls. The area houses notable landmarks such as the Duomo di Bergamo, Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore, and Cappella Colleoni. The culinary scene in Bergamo has also been making waves with restaurants like Impronte gaining a Michelin star.
name: Bergamo

excerpt: Colored marble exterior & frescoed ceiling in a 15th-century funerary chapel with columns & statues.
detail_description: The Colleoni Chapel, located in Bergamo, is a stunning 15th-century funerary chapel known for its colored marble exterior and frescoed ceiling. This Italian Renaissance masterpiece is dedicated to Saints Bartholomew, Mark, and John the Baptist and features an overwhelming mass of decoration that dazzles the eye.
name: Colleoni Chapel

detail_description: In the heart of Bergamo Alta, Piazza Vecchia is a bustling square surrounded by historical landmarks. One of the prominent buildings here is Palazzo della Ragione, which boasts a facade adorned with the lion of St. Mark. Adjacent to this municipal building is the imposing Palazzo Nuovo housing the Angelo Mai Civic Library.
name: Palazzo della Ragione (Palazzo Vecchio)

excerpt: This tower was built in the 12th century as a home for the Suardi family & offers panoramic views.
detail_description: Campanone, also known as the Civic Tower, is a medieval tower located in Bergamo's Upper Town. Standing at over 52 meters high, it was built in the 12th century and offers panoramic views of the old town and its mountainous surroundings. Visitors can access the observation deck via a staircase with around 230 steps or take an elevator for convenience.
name: Campanone

excerpt: This historic cathedral with a neoclassical facade & notable artwork is the seat of a bishop.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Città Alta, Bergamo Cathedral is a stunning testament to history and architecture that dates back to the 12th century. This remarkable structure showcases an impressive neoclassical facade adorned with intricate sculptures, while its grand nave and soaring dome dominate the skyline of Old Town. As you step inside, you'll be greeted by a treasure trove of artistic masterpieces, including works by renowned artists like Giovan Battista Moroni and Andrea Previtali.
name: Bergamo Cathedral

detail_description: Ufficio Turistico - Bergamo Città Bassa is located in the lower town of Bergamo, Italy. The city is divided into two parts: the historic Citta Alta (Upper Town) and Citta Bassa (Lower Town), surrounded by picturesque natural beauty including green hills and the snow-capped Orobic Alps.
name: Ufficio Turistico - Bergamo Città Bassa
address: Piazzale Guglielmo Marconi, 24122 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: Piazza Vecchia in Bergamo Alta is a charming public square steeped in history and surrounded by iconic landmarks. The Contarini fountain, Palazzo della Ragione, and the imposing Campanone Clock Tower are just a few of the architectural marvels that adorn this picturesque space. Visitors can also admire the Cathedral, Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore with its intricate carvings by Lorenzo Lotto, and the Baptistery featuring Colleoni's coat of arms.
name: Piazza Vecchia Bergamo Alta

excerpt: Imposing 14th-c. stronghold with a tower offering panoramic views & a museum of Bergamo's history.
detail_description: Rocca di Bergamo is a striking 14th-century fortress situated on the hill of Sant'Eufemia in Bergamo's upper town. It offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city and the Alps. The fortress houses a section of the city's history museum, providing an intriguing look into Bergamo's rich past. Visitors can explore remnants from the city's military history while strolling through the grounds.
name: Rocca di Bergamo
address: Piazzale Brigata Legnano, 16, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: In Bergamo's lower city, known as citta bassa, visitors can indulge in a modern shopping experience without leaving the area. Via XX Settembre, the bustling heart of this district, is lined with vibrant cafes and an array of boutiques and shops. Named to commemorate a significant milestone in Italy's history, this charming street offers a lively atmosphere for leisurely strolls and retail therapy.
name: Via XX Settembre

excerpt: Gallery in a 15th-century convent, showing 20th-century Italian pieces & work by emerging artists.
detail_description: GAMeC, the Modern and Contemporary Art Gallery of Bergamo, is housed in a 15th-century convent opposite the Carrara Academy. It was established in 1991 and occupies 1,500 square meters across ten rooms on three floors. The gallery features four main collections: the Pio Manzu Collection of Industrial Design Works, the Spajani Collection, the Stucchi Collection, and the Kaleidoscope Room.
name: GAMeC - Modern and Contemporary Art Gallery of Bergamo
address: Via San Tomaso, 53, 24121 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: La Marianna is a renowned bar and pastry shop known for its delicious fiordilatte gelato enriched with large pieces of dark chocolate. The idea for this delectable treat originated from the recipe for stracciatella alla romana and has been a specialty at La Marianna since 1961. The cafe, currently managed by Niccolo Panattoni, offers seating in a charming shaded courtyard, making it an ideal spot for breakfast or a snack before or after an afternoon concert.
name: La Marianna
address: L.go Colle Aperto, 4, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Remains of an ancient stone castle on a hill with hidden underground tunnels & views over the town.
detail_description: Torre Castello San Vigilio is an ancient stone castle located on a hill in Bergamo, offering stunning panoramic views of the town and surrounding mountain ranges. Accessible by a funicular railway, this spot provides a peaceful retreat with plenty of seating areas to enjoy the contrasting scenery. The castle ruins and hidden underground tunnels add to the allure of this historical site. While currently closed due to the pandemic, visitors can still explore the beautiful garden and capture breathtaking photos of the landscape.
name: Torre Castello San Vigilio
address: Via al Castello, 14, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo Nuovo, located in Bergamo Alta, Italy, stands out with its bright white marbles and houses the Angelo Mai Civic Library. This important library holds over 600,000 volumes, more than 2,000 incunabula, and over 16,000 manuscripts. The palace itself has a rich history as it was the seat of the Municipality of Bergamo for three centuries until 1873.
name: Palazzo Nuovo

detail_description: Battistero is located near the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore, making it convenient to visit both. Despite its unassuming exterior, this white marble cathedral surprises visitors with its grandeur once they step inside.
name: Battistero

detail_description: L.go Colle Aperto is a charming and picturesque destination that offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape. Visitors can explore the historic architecture, wander through the quaint streets, and immerse themselves in the local culture. The area is known for its vibrant atmosphere and is a great place to relax and take in the beauty of the region. With its unique blend of old-world charm and modern amenities, L.
name: L.go Colle Aperto

excerpt: Built for defense, these iconic 16-century walls are a popular walking spot with sweeping views.
detail_description: Mura Veneziane-Patrimonio UNESCO, the stunning 16th-century defensive walls, offer visitors a remarkable walking experience with breathtaking panoramic views. These historic structures not only showcase Italy's rich cultural heritage but also play a vital role in promoting tourism in cities recognized as UNESCO Creative Cities. The initiative aims to enhance the appeal and competitiveness of these locations by supporting projects that highlight their unique cultural assets.
name: Mura Veneziane
address: Viale delle Mura, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy
